Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which Mike Pence "slashed education funding" in Indiana.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that education funding in Indiana has been on the rise every year since Pence took office.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Pence significantly cut education funding.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that investing in education is always superior to cutting funding, without considering other factors or priorities.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the changes in education funding, such as revenue shortfalls and redistribution of funds to different districts.
